name: London Marriott Hotel Maida Vale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location in London, well located hotel.Good professional service.Modern well appointed rooms, We liked the decor and the service.Very nice breakfast and polite front desk & housekeeping service.
reviews.title: very professional well located hotel

reviews.text: A little less pricey than downtown London, and only a short metro ride.
reviews.title: Good spot near Metro....

reviews.text: Rooms were clean and comfortable. I was made to feel very welcome. Rooms are small, like most hotel rooms in Europe are.
reviews.title: It's in Kilburn not Maida Vale !
Marriott where
reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights on 28th nov 2011 on a business trip. First of all I admit that I didn't check he location other that it's called mId vale. I got the tube to maida vale station and when I came upto ground I asked around but no one knew where the Marriott was. No problem - I got my phone out and looked on google maps. I was dissapointed to see that he hotel is actually in Kilburn! On Kilburn high street. The nearest tube is Kilburn park. I had a yen minute walk to the hotel down a rather dodgy looking road.
The hotel also has a residential tower block directly opposite. It sort of looks a little dodgy in my opinion - though I had no problems - it's just a visual thing.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in November 2011 for 1 night with my wife. The location is interesting! If you like walking you'll be fine, as the nearest tube station is a good 5-10 mins away. There are plenty of buses past the hotel however and it is outside the congestion charge zone.
reviews.title: One Night Blast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was nice, spacious with a really comfy bed. Good facilities in the room. Even an orange at the side of the bed!!
reviews.title: Great weekend break to London

reviews.text: In all a nice hotel, as most will be in London.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the reception staff

reviews.text: I have no idea of the price of this hotel as it was a surprise birthday weekend from my boyfriend, so cannot comment on the value for money / check in/out process as I dont know but the hotel is lovely and I felt spoilt all weekend!
reviews.title: exellent rail links to central london and nationally

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove down to London and the parked the car at the hotel's underground parking. The charge for this is over 20 pounds a night which is so expensive, but we had no choice and it is safe underground parking.
reviews.title: Experience at the Marriott Maida Vale London

reviews.text: The hotel, although fairly nice looking from outside, is in my opinion below the level one would expect from a Marriott. The rooms are pretty tacky, and for example there was no 2-pin shaver socket im my bathroom. I had to request an adaptior which was charged to my room until I returned it to reception. The whole feeling of the hotel was not what I expected, nor what I am accustomed to from a Marriott. However, all the staff I came into contact with were exceptional, and breakfast was pretty good indeed!
reviews.title: Below what you would expect from a Marriott, but great staff

reviews.text: A standard Marriott in Kilburn (not Maida Vale as the name would imply). Rooms are ok, food alright but on a cold February night the room was totally freezing and the aircon wasn't heating at all. I've stayed before and it's been a standard Marriott in a box, nothing special but serviceable.
reviews.title: Stay like an Eskimo

reviews.text: This time I ended up wearing the bath robe over my clothes to keep warm.
reviews.title: Nice, but not in the city

reviews.text: The hotel is nice, clean and comfortable, but is not easily accesible. If you coming from the city you have to catch a couple of trains or buses to get there. The closest station is Kilburn Park Tube Station, which is about a 5-minute walk from the hotel. The breakfast was great. The staff was courteous. I think is a good deal if you compare it with the cost of staying closer to the city. They have a nice bar and a restaurant and the prices are comparable to what you would pay outside the hotel. There is also a small area with foostable and some other games for kids. There's also a bar/restaurant about a block away that get's really crowded in the weekends. I would recommend the hotel, if you don't mind a little commuting to the city.
reviews.title: Central Bargain

reviews.text: Out of town prices and yet still very central.
reviews.title: Good value hotel but outside the city centre

reviews.text: Fairly new Marriott will look quite familiar to anyone that stays at Marriott hotels in the US - Modern, up-to-date with plenty of room.
reviews.title: Good option just off the beaten path...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location in Kilburn seems a bit odd - but with just a few block (5 minute walk to the) Kilburn Park Tube Station, you are just a few stops from Paddington and a couple of more to Bond/Regent Street - A lower price typically than very central London more than makes up for this. On the plus side when you walk to the Tube station there is a Starbucks just up the street on Kilburn High Street - Perfect for a morning coffee and quick snack while taking the tube to where you need to be (there's also a quick stop grocery store nearby as well if you need some snackies to take back to your room)
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the hotel - especially for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And while the hotel has a decent bar - the food in it was absolutely terrible - seemed to be frozen food service stuff just microwaved up - the beer and drinks were fine (hard to screw that up) but the food was so bad I didn't even want to try the Italian restaurant also on site so can't comment on that.
reviews.title: great weekend break

reviews.text: I would though recommend the Queen's Arms just across the street for good beer and better than average pub food - couldn't get enough of this place.
reviews.title: NOT HELPFUL..........HORRIBLE...... JUN THE RECEPCIONIST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally for those that like to go for a nice run - head down to the Regents Canal where you can run for miles on the tow path all the way to the Thames or around Regent Park.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the location

description: Elegant Hotel part of a new complex, situated in prestigious Maida Vale.
